title: Plinia yasuniana
text: Plinia yasuniana is a species of <a href="plant">plant</a> in the family <a href="Myrtaceae">Myrtaceae</a>. It is <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> to the understory of the <a href="Amazonian%20rainforest">Amazonian rainforest</a> in <a href="Yasuni%20National%20Park">Yasuni National Park</a> in north-east <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>. The plant is a <a href="shrub">shrub</a> that grows to between 1 and 3 metres tall. It produces <a href="cauliflorous">cauliflorous</a>, white flowers around 4 to 6mm long and edible, yellow fruits around 30mm in diameter, between August and November. It is named after the national park in which it was discovered in 2009.
